4.desc_api: Hamilton Tiger-Cats linebacker Simoni Lawrence says he threatened to cry for eight straight days if Delvin Breaux didn’t choose Steeltown for his return to the Canadian Football League.

5.title_api: Lions fan hires law firm after hit by player
5.caption_api: A security guard runs in after B.C. Lions’ Marcell Young (8) knocked down a spectator that ran onto the field of play during the first half of a CFL football game against the Montreal Alouettes in Vancouver, on Saturday June 16, 2018. A streaking fan who was hit by a B.C. Lions player has retained the services of a Toronto law firm. THE CANADIAN PRESS/Darryl Dyck
5.desc_api: Streaking fan levelled by Lions player hires Toronto-based law firm

13.title_api: Veteran quarterback Ray still feels sting of ’02 Grey Cup defeat
13.desc_api: Ricky Ray has won more Grey Cups than any starting quarterback, but he still feels the sting from the one that got away.

15.title_api: Argonauts home opener nearly sold out
15.caption_api: Toronto Argonauts running back James Wilder Jr. (32) leaps past Calgary Stampeders’ Alex Singleton, left, and Ciante Evans during second half CFL football action in the 105th Grey Cup on Sunday, November 26, 2017 in Ottawa. A Grey Cup rematch seems to be resonating with Toronto Argonauts fans. The defending CFL champions will face the Calgary Stampeders in their home opener Saturday night, a game that’s close to being sold out. THE CANADIAN PRESS/Ryan Remiorz
15.desc_api: Toronto Argonauts home opener versus Calgary Stampeders almost sold out

16.title_api: Walker continues to shine for Eskimos
16.caption_api: Edmonton Eskimos’ Derel Walker (87) celebrates his touchdown during first half CFL action in Edmonton, Alta., on Saturday September 9, 2017. While two go-to guys from an Edmonton Eskimos’ offence that led the CFL in passing yardage in 2017 have gone away, receiver Derel Walker takes the field against the Hamilton Tiger-cats at Commonwealth Stadium Friday having made it abundantly clear he’s still here. THE CANADIAN PRESS/Amber Bracken
16.desc_api: Walker continues to shine for Eskimos after departure of Bowman, Zylstra

17.title_api: Willy looks to prove former team wrong

18.title_api: Clemson’s Swinney not worried despite several QB transfers
18.caption_api: FILE - In this Jan. 1, 2018, file photo, Clemson quarterback Kelly Bryant (2) passes in the first half of the Sugar Bowl NCAA college football bowl game against Alabama, in New Orleans. Clemson coach Dabo Swinney is not concerned about his quarterback spot, even though the once-loaded depth at the position has been cut in half. (AP Photo/Rusty Costanza, File)
18.desc_api: Clemson’s Swinney not worried despite several QB transfers

19.title_api: A high-speed sprint to the top
19.caption_api: Myles Misener-Daley is the fastest runner in Canada in his age group in the 100, 200 and 400 metre distances.
19.desc_api: Just 13 months after competing in his first 400-metre race, Hamilton’s Myles Misener-Daley has run the fastest 400-metre race this year by any Canadian, of any age.

20.title_api: It was there for the Ticats … and then it wasn’t, in 28-14 loss in Calgary
20.caption_api: Hamilton Tiger-Cats’ Richard Leonard, left, covers Calgary Stampeders’ Kamar Jorden as he tries to catch a touchdown pass.
20.desc_api: Turnover ends hope of ending Calgary drought

21.title_api: Hamiltonian leads Yale to its first title in 135 years
21.caption_api: Hamilton native Matt Gaudet scored 10 goals on 13 shots in Yale’s semifinal and NCAA championship games.
21.desc_api: Matt Gaudet opened the season battling to keep his position on the field; but ended it as the top player on the only weekend that really matters.

22.title_api: For Ticats, it’s been awhile since they won in Calgary
22.caption_api: The Hamilton Tiger-Cats spent a lot of time trying to catch Calgary Stampeder players when the teams met last July.

23.title_api: Ticats set roster, and yes, Manziel made the team
23.caption_api: Hamilton Tiger-Cats quarterback Johnny Manziel looks for an open receiver Saturday in Montreal against the Alouettes.

24.title_api: Manziel sparks Ticats comeback in final pre-season game
24.caption_api: Ticats QB Johnny Manziel throws the ball during first half preseason CFL football action against the Montreal Alouettes in Montreal, Saturday.
24.desc_api: Hamilton scores 30 straight points in come-from-behind win.

25.title_api: All hype aside, Masoli’s QB1 for Ticats
25.caption_api: Jeremiah Masoli, left, Dane Evans, Vernon Adams Jr., Bryant Moniz and Johnny Manziel are all in Tiger-Cat training camp, but Masoli is the undisputed No. 1. quarterback.
25.desc_api: On the eve of the team’s first pre-season game and with the Johnny Manziel hype cranked up all the way to 11, Hamilton Tiger-Cats head coach June Jones reiterated that Jeremiah Masoli will begin the season as the team’s No. 1 quarterback — no matter what.

26.desc_api: Johnny Manziel has almost 2.3 million followers on Twitter and another 2 million on Instagram, so it’s hardly surprising that he’s already something of a recognizable face in Hamilton.

41.desc_api: There was no Grey Cup redemption for Bo Levi Mitchell and the Calgary Stampeders.

42.title_api: Ex-NFL, Alabama player Keith McCants arrested on drug charge
42.caption_api: FILE - In this Jan 17, 2009, file photo, Keith McCants poses for a portrait in Mobile, Ala. Pinellas County Jail records show 50-year-old Keith McCants, a former defensive end for the Tampa Bay Buccaneers and the University of Alabama, was arrested early Monday, June 25, 2018, near St. Petersburg, Fla. He’s charged with a felony count of possession of crack cocaine and driving with a revoked or suspended license. (AP Photo/Press-Register, John David Mercer, File)
42.desc_api: Ex-NFL, Alabama player Keith McCants arrested on drug charge

43.caption_api: Toronto Argonauts’ general manager Jim Popp speaks to media at the Argo practice facility in Toronto, on Wednesday, November 29, 2017. The Toronto Argonauts have started their Grey Cup defence 0-2 and are coming a lopsided 34-point loss to the Calgary Stampeders. But don’t expect general manager Jim Popp to make wholescale changes during the CFL club’s bye week. THE CANADIAN PRESS/Christopher Katsarov
43.desc_api: Running back Jackson off to impressive start with Calgary Stampeders

46.title_api: Jeremiah Masoli has put a stranglehold on Ticats starting QB job
46.caption_api: Jeremiah Masoli has stared down and outperformed two of the top quarterbacks, on the road, the first two weeks of the CFL schedule.
46.desc_api: Though it will likely disappoint the I-want-to-see-Johnny crowd, Jeremiah Masoli has put a stranglehold on the Hamilton Tiger-Cats starting quarterback job.

47.title_api: Peterborough junior varsity, bantam Wolverines beat Toronto Jr. Argos
47.desc_api: The Peterborough Wolverines completed the fifth week of the Ontario Football Conference by hosting the Toronto Jr. Argos in a triple header at the Thomas A. Stewart Field on Saturday.

48.title_api: Ray to miss “significant time” with injury
48.caption_api: Toronto Argonauts wide receiver Brian Tyms (18) and Toronto Argonauts wide receiver Brian Jones (16) sit dejected on the bench following their CFL football game loss to the Calgary Stampeders at BMO Field in Toronto, Ontario on Saturday June 23, 2018. The Calgary Stampeders thumped Toronto 41-7 on Saturday night in a rematch of last year’s Grey Cup, which the Argonauts won 27-24. The lopsided loss came after the club’s season-opening 27-19 road defeat to the Saskatchewan Roughriders. THE CANADIAN PRESS/Cole Burston
48.desc_api: Argos GM Popp not looking to make wholescale changes despite 0-2 start

49.title_api: Ticats have Timmis on the run
49.caption_api: Hamilton Tiger-Cats running back Mercer Timmis had his best game as a pro Friday in Edmonton.
49.desc_api: This was what the Hamilton Tiger-Cats envisioned for Mercer Timmis when they took him 14th overall in the 2016 draft.

50.desc_api: City police called to Peterborough Wolverines, Toronto Jr. Argos senior varsity game Saturday

51.title_api: Ray’s injury graphic example of CFL’s graphic reality
51.caption_api: Ricky Ray is taken off the field on a stretcher Saturday. He was injured on a play against the Calgary Stampeders.
51.desc_api: As news of the injury to Toronto Argonauts quarterback Ricky Ray spread across social media on Saturday night, the words of support and offers of prayer came pouring in.

55.title_api: South Florida hires CFP exec Kelly as athletic director

The people spoke to The Associated Press on condition of anonymity Tuesday, June 26, 2018, because a formal announcement was being finalized. (AP Photo/The Florida Times-Union, Bruce Lipsky, File)

62.title_api: Former Penn State president Spanier loses criminal appeal
62.caption_api: FILE ‚Äì In this March 20, 2017, file photo, former Penn State president Graham Spanier walks to the Dauphin County Courthouse in Harrisburg, Pa. Spanier lost an appeal Tuesday, June 26, 2018, of his misdemeanor conviction for child endangerment over his handling of a 2001 complaint about Jerry Sandusky showering with a boy in the football team locker room. (AP Photo/Matt Rourke, File)

63.title_api: U of C developing handheld concussion sensor
63.caption_api: Jeff Pilon of the Calgary Stampeders holds the Grey Cup up after their win over the Montreal Alouettes in the 96th CFL Grey Cup Sunday, Nov. 23, 2008 in Montreal. A pinprick of blood that tells you within 30 minutes if you have a concussion is technology the University of Calgary is developing and tech former Calgary Stampeder Jeff Pilon says would have changed his football career. THE CANADIAN PRESS/Adrian Wyld
63.desc_api: University of Calgary developing handheld concussion sensor for sideline use

68.title_api: Wife of Denver Broncos owner says she also has Alzheimer’s
68.caption_api: FILE - In this Nov. 19, 2017, file photo, Annabel Bowlen, wife of Denver Broncos owner Pat Bowlen, looks on during an NFL football game between the Broncos and Cincinnati Bengals, in Denver. The wife of Denver Broncos owner Pat Bowlen says she has Alzheimer’s, a disease which led her husband to give up control of the team four years ago. In an announcement Wednesday, June 27, 2018, Annabel Bowlen said she wanted to make her diagnosis public right away to help raise awareness about others dealing with it.(AP Photo/Jack Dempsey, File)
68.desc_api: Wife of Denver Broncos owner says she also has Alzheimer’s

78.title_api: Brother of Giants’ Janoris Jenkins charged in man’s death
78.caption_api: In this June 26, 2018 photo, Bergen County Prosecutors Office and Sheriff’s Department investigate a body found in the home of Giants cornerback Janoris Jenkins in Fair Lawn, N.J. 79.title_api: NFL suspends Bucs QB Jameis Winston for 3 games
79.caption_api: FILE - In this June 14, 2018, file photo, Tampa Bay Buccaneers quarterback Jameis Winston (3) throws during an NFL football minicamp in Tampa, Fla. Winston has been suspended for the first three games of the regular season for violating the NFL’s personal conduct policy. Winston says in a statement released on Facebook that the NFL informed him of their decision on Thursday, June 28, 2018.(AP Photo/Chris O’Meara, File)
79.desc_api: NFL suspends Bucs QB Jameis Winston for 3 games

80.title_api: NFL fines ex-Panthers owner $2.75M after misconduct review
80.caption_api: FILE - In this Jan. 24, 2016, file photo, then Carolina Panthers owner Jerry Richardson watches before the NFL football NFC Championship game against the Arizona Cardinals, in Charlotte, N.C. The NFL has fined former Carolina Panthers owner Jerry Richardson $2.75 million following its investigation into sexual and racial misconduct in the workplace. The league said Thursday, June 28, 2018, the investigation conducted by former U.S. Attorney Mary Jo White substantiated allegations against Richardson, that the improper conduct was limited to Richardson and that the team failed to report the allegations or any resolution agreements to the league.(AP Photo/Bob Leverone, File)
80.desc_api: NFL fines ex-Panthers owner $2.75M after misconduct review

81.title_api: Early struggles have Esks seeking answers
81.caption_api: Hamilton Tiger-Cats Mike Daly (35) and Julian Howsare (95) try to tackle Edmonton Eskimos quarterback Mike Reilly (13) during second half CFL action in Edmonton, Alta., on Friday June 22, 2018. Sweeping personnel changes and injuries have played a significant part in early season struggles by the Edmonton Eskimos - defence, but they’re going to need answers, not excuses, when Jonathon Jennings and the B.C. Lions come calling at Commonwealth Stadium Friday. THE CANADIAN PRESS/Jason Franson.
81.desc_api: Esks seeking answers, not excuses, as they seek to right the ship against Lions

82.title_api: Als look to bounce back against ‘Riders
82.caption_api: Montreal Alouettes players run onto the field prior to their season home opening CFL football game against the Winnipeg Blue Bombers in Montreal, Friday, June 22, 2018. Defence was supposed to be the Montreal Alouettes’ strength, but after surrendering 56 points in a blowout loss to Winnipeg to drop to 0-2 they are searching for answers. THE CANADIAN PRESS/Graham Hughes
82.desc_api: Alouettes look to bounce back in Saskatchewan after rough start to season

83.caption_api: Hamilton Tiger-Cats quarterback Jeremiah Masoli (8) makes the throw against the Edmonton Eskimos during first half CFL action in Edmonton, Alta., on Friday June 22, 2018. Tiger-Cats QB Jeremiah Masoli and Blue Bombers quarterback Chris Streveler were in the CFL’s top three performers for Week 2 of the season. For Week 3, they’ll be on the same field in Hamilton’s home opener. THE CANADIAN PRESS/Jason Franson.
83.desc_api: Masoli and Streveler ready for QB showdown as Bombers visit Tiger-Cats

84.title_api: Bombers vs Ticats: Time to toughen up on home turf
84.caption_api: Since opening their new stadium with 10 straight victories, the Tiger-Cats are just 2-12 in their last 14 at Tim Hortons Field.
84.desc_api: There was a time, not so long ago, that included with the towels and soap in the visitors’ locker room at Tim Hortons Field, was the certainty of defeat.

85.title_api: The Reklaws to perform at kickoff show
85.desc_api: Country duo The Reklaws to perform at Grey Cup kickoff show in Edmonton

86.title_api: Alouettes look to bounce back in Saskatchewan after rough start to season
86.caption_api: Alouettes quarterback Drew Willy (5) is sacked by Winnipeg Blue Bombers’ Anthony Gaitor in Montreal last Friday.
86.desc_api: The talk was all about resilience and staying positive among the Montreal Alouettes this week.

87.title_api: Esks seeking answers, not excuses, as they seek to right the ship against Lions
87.caption_api: Hamilton Tiger-Cats Mike Daly and Julian Howsare (95) try to tackle Eskimos quarterback Mike Reilly during in Edmonton last Friday. Sweeping personnel changes and injuries have played a significant part in early season struggles by the Esks’ defence, but they’re going to need answers, not excuses, when Jonathon Jennings and the B.C. Lions come calling at Commonwealth Stadium on Friday.
87.desc_api: Given injuries and all the new faces, it might have been tempting for the Edmonton Eskimos to lean on excuses after having their defence dominated last week.

88.title_api: Eskimos brass on northern visits to talk about name, ‘where we fit in’

95.title_api: Jeremiah Masoli marches Ticats to hometown win over Bombers

95.desc_api: There is a school of thought in the CFL that says it’s perfectly OK for a defence to give up a bunch of short-range stuff underneath, challenging offences to complete pass after pass to move the ball down the field. Only the elite quarterbacks, the thinking goes, are accurate enough to get it done.

96.title_api: Offence, defence come up big for Ticats in home opener

96.desc_api: The best defence is a good offence. Especially if that offence has the help of a good defence.

Owens has decided to celebrate his induction into the Hall of Fame at Chattanooga, where he played college football. The former NFL All-Pro receiver, who has said he was not attending the induction ceremony in Canton, Oho, posted a release on Tuesday, July 3, 2018, saying he would give his acceptance speech at his alma mater. 111.title_api: NFL suspends 49ers linebacker Reuben Foster 2 games

The NFL said Tuesday, July 3, 2018, that Foster will also be fined for violations from a weapons offense and misdemeanor drug charge that were resolved earlier this offseason. (AP Photo/Jeff Chiu, File)

The Toronto Argonauts are now James Franklin’s team. Franklin will make his first start with Toronto on Saturday night when the club hosts the Edmonton Eskimos at BMO Field. Franklin takes over as the Argos’ No. 1 quarterback with incumbent Ricky Ray sidelined with a neck injury. The Toronto Argonauts are now James Franklin’s team.Franklin will make his first start with Toronto on Saturday night when the club hosts the Edmonton Eskimos at BMO Field. 130.title_api: James Franklin takes over the Argos’ helm
130.caption_api: Toronto Argonauts quarterback James Franklin (2) prepares to make a throw during the second half of CFL football game action against the Calgary Stampeders in Toronto on June 23, 2018. The future starts now for the winless Toronto Argonauts, with James Franklin at the helm instead of talismanic veteran Ricky Ray. And as luck would have it, Franklin will make his first start as an Argos this weekend against his former team, the Edmonton Eskimos. Just to add some extra spice, Saturday’s contest at BMO Field is the first half of a home-and-away series that continues July 13 at Commonwealth Stadium. THE CANADIAN PRESS/Cole Burston
130.desc_api: With Ricky Ray down, Argos look to quarterback James Franklin to lead the way

Pettigrew was arrested in Pittsburgh early Monday, July 9, 2018, for punching an officer in the chest after refusing to pay $97 for a limo ride to a hotel, according to police, who say the NFL free agent and former Lions player has been charged with two counts of aggravated assault, theft of services and public drunkenness. 150.title_api: NFL players union files grievance over anthem policy
150.caption_api: FILE - In this Dec. 24, 2017, file photo, San Francisco 49ers outside linebacker Eli Harold, from bottom left, kneels with safety Eric Reid, wide receiver Marquise Goodwin and wide receiver Louis Murphy during the national anthem before an NFL football game against the Jacksonville Jaguars in Santa Clara, Calif. The NFL Players Association filed a grievance with the league challenging its national anthem policy. The union says that the new policy, which the league imposed without consultation with the NFLPA, is inconsistent with the collective bargaining agreement and infringes on player rights. (AP Photo/Marcio Jose Sanchez, File)

152.title_api: Bills’ McCoy denies allegation of bloodying girlfriend
152.caption_api: FILE - In this Dec. 17, 2017, file photo, Buffalo Bills running back LeSean McCoy (25) speaks with the media following an NFL football game against the Miami Dolphins, in Orchard Park, N.Y. LeSean McCoy says an allegation posted on social media accusing him of bloodying his former girlfriend’s face is baseless and false. An Instagram post Tuesday, July 10, 2018, from a person who says she is friends with the woman showed a graphic photo of the former girlfriend and accuses McCoy of physically abusing her, his son and his dog, as well as injecting steroids. 154.title_api: CFL, Argos aware of issues at BMO Field
154.caption_api: The Hamilton Tiger-Cats kick off to start the game against the Toronto Argonauts during the first half of CFL football preseason action in Toronto on June 11, 2016. Randy Ambrosie is well aware of the turf issues at BMO Field and the CFL commissioner says both the league and Toronto Argonauts are discussing potential ways to rectify the situation. That comes after Edmonton receiver Derel Walker slipped and fell in the north end zone at BMO Field on Saturday night, resulting in an interception in the first half of Toronto’s eventual 20-17 victory. THE CANADIAN PRESS/Mark Blinch
